nodes.bodyText: I don't think (indirectly) is suitable here, it should just be Checks if a block is indirectly or directly powered by redstone

If you put brackets () in register(), it means that that's a mandatory field, i.e. redstone powered will no longer be a valid condition with your change. I think you meant to use square brackets [] instead? Those indicate that it's an optional phrase.

The way they did it is valid, since the options would be "" and "indirectly"
Maybe redstone should be optional though
Really? Didn't know that about parse marks... haha

Thank you for your reviews!
Concerning making redstone optional, I was advised to use redstone power to avoid conflicts (#3091 (comment)).

Also, you don't need parse marks for these, you can register 2 separate condition patterns, like
Skript.registerCondition(CondCanHold.class,
				"%inventories% (can hold|ha(s|ve) [enough] space (for|to hold)) %itemtypes%",
				"%inventories% (can(no|')t hold|(ha(s|ve) not|ha(s|ve)n't|do[es]n't have) [enough] space (for|to hold)) %itemtypes%");

But you would need to change the class declaration to public class CondIsBlockRedstonePowered extends Condition... although other developers might prefer parse marks, I think that's up for discussion.

They could get rid of the 0 parse mark, making it just
(|1¦indirectly)
or just do two patterns to reduce the needless complexity
I'm going to use two patterns; thanks for your reviews.
There is no need to use a Boolean object, a primitive will do
You don't need to return PropertyCondition.toString, just "redstone" + (isIndirectlyPowered ? "indirectly " : "") + "powered" should do
this actually isn't true the way he had it before was correct
Maybe we could have [directly] redstone powered as patterns as well?
You're right; I will add it.
